metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3650 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:C API). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.18 and earlier.Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker withnetwork access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized readaccess to a subset of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 3.7(Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
percona-server-5.6 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
